metadata.title: CVE-2017-15398 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A stack buffer overflow in the QUIC networking stack in Google Chrome priorto 62.0.3202.89 allowed a remote attacker to gain code execution via amalicious server.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15398` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu0.16.04.1315
chromium-browser-l10n - 62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu0.16.04.1315
chromium-chromedriver - 62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu0.16.04.1315
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu0.16.04.1315
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu0.16.04.1315
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3202.89-0ubuntu0.16.04.1315').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
